creator: Leslie.Ramer@peregrine.com
text:
This problem is related to CSS.  Turning CSS off when writing the SVG seems to 
fix the problem at the expense of styled SVG's.  CSS wasn't necessary for my 
project, so this is a reasonable workaround.

Regardless, this appears to be the only attribute that has this behavior.  I'm 
assuming that, since "fill" is a standard style for other SVG elements, that it 
is being improperly interpretted.

Of course, the behavior I expect is that "fill" is treated as a standard 
nonstylable attribute for the "animate" element.
